snippet: "I do not buy the notion that we have to make a choice between having clean air and clean water and growing this economy in a robust way," the president tells agency employees.
abstract: "I do not buy the notion that we have to make a choice between having clean air and clean water and growing this economy in a robust way," the president tells agency employees.
lead_paragraph: President Obama, who has been both applauded and jeered for his record on environmental issues, paid a brief visit to the headquarters of the Environmental Protection Agency in Washington on Tuesday to try to raise spirits at an agency that has been under siege for the past year.
